definition: to wrangle/wrangling
to pull/to tear/(of cloth, thread etc) to buy/to chat/to gossip/(coll.) (Tw) ridiculous/hokey
variant of 扯[che3]/to pull/to tear
leather/skin/fur/CL:張|张[zhang1]/pico- (one trillionth)/naughty
surname Pi
to pass the buck/to shirk responsibility
see 拉皮條|拉皮条[la1 pi2 tiao2]

sentences.english: Between departments should strengthen coordination and cooperation, not buck-passing.
sentences.chinese: 部门之间要加强协调配合，不能推诿扯皮。

sentences.english: I'm not playing roommate chicken with you on this.
Such problems are often caused by the buck-passing between developers and owners.
sentences.chinese: 这类问题，往往造成开发商同房主之间互相扯皮。

sentences.english: I am not going to bandy words. I require you to give up this friendship.
sentences.chinese: 我不想再扯皮下去了，我要你们放弃这种友谊。

sentences.english: The matter in dispute over trifles is the ownership of the house.
sentences.chinese: 眼下扯皮的事是这所房子该归谁。

definition: to pass the buck/to shirk responsibility
to wear out the skin of one's teeth (idiom); pointlessly blather/to talk incessant nonsense/blah blah
mutually shirking responsibilities (idiom); each blaming the other/passing the buck to and fro/each trying to unload responsibilities onto the other
to negotiate (with)/to have dealings (with)
can't come to an agreement
to kick a ball around/(fig.) to mutually shirk responsibility/to pass the buck
to haggle over price/to bargain
to dispute/to disagree/to argue opinionatedly/to wrangle
to try to smooth things over/to paper over the issues/to gloss things over
to chat/idle talk
to negotiate/negotiation/talks/conference/CL:個|个[ge4]
internal friction/internal dissipation of energy (in mechanics)/fig. waste or discord within an organization
to decline/to avoid/shirking responsibilities/to blame others/to pass the buck/to unload one's responsibilities/to try to get out of a task
dispute
to idle on the job
to talk about this and that (idiom); to ramble incoherently
